questions.text: What are rate, ratio, and proportion commonly referred to as in the context of epidemiology?

options.label: C
options.text: Basic tools of measurement in epidemiology

questions.correct_answer: C. Basic tools of measurement in epidemiology
questions.explanation:
Measure Definition
Ratio A comparison of two numbers, e.g., male to female ratio
Proportion A type of ratio where the numerator is part of the denominator, e.g., % of infected
Rate A proportion with a time component, e.g., incidence rate per year

questions.text: In a small town with a population of 2,00,000 people, a public health team is investigating an outbreak of gastroenteritis. Over one month, 1,500 new cases of gastroenteritis are reported. Calculate the incidence rate of gastroenteritis in the above population.

A health survey reported 5 confirmed cases of Chronic Kidney Disease in a community of 100 people in December. By the end of January, 3 new cases of CKD were diagnosed. Prevalence was reported for Dec and Jan, particularly on Jan 31st. Which of the following statements is true in this scenario?

options.label: A
options.text: Point prevalence is more than period prevalence

options.label: B
options.text: Point prevalence is less than period prevalence

options.label: C
options.text: Point prevalence is equal to period prevalence

options.label: D
options.text: Point prevalence and Period prevalence cannot be compared

questions.correct_answer: C. Point prevalence is equal to period prevalence
